name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Elizabeth City

reviews.text: Although I prefer and tend to stay at Residence Inns, this Fairfield Inn is new, clean, and well equipped. It offers a nice morning breakfast. But the couple of evening receptions during the week are more finger foods and not intended to be a meal, but this is a Fairfield.
reviews.title: Your best bet for Elizabeth City, hands down

reviews.text: Unlike many hotels these days that claims to offer "high speed" internet the in room wireless service here is good. The cable channel lineup is also better than many hotels as it offers numerous channels that would make you think you're home rather than the typical 10-15 typical of hotel offerings. And it's clean cable as in no annoying repeating power on menus, sales pitches and overcomplicated menus and their remotes.
reviews.title: GREAT STAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a nice work out area and a heated and clean indoor pool, although a little on the small side.
reviews.title: Very nice, new hotel, an excellent option!

reviews.text: The counter staff are very friendly and helpful. My only gripe with any of the staff would be the lady that hosts the morning breakfast during most week days. I stayed over a long term visit, and when I would report make minor issues she needs to be more receptive and less defensive.
reviews.title: Expensive but worth it.

reviews.text: Stayed at Fairfield Inn for wedding on June28 to June 30th.We only had reservations for one night but thanks to manager Dewayne Wilson he was able to get us Friday night also he had to make multiple phone call to Marriott Rewards to get it worked out thanks again to Mr. Wilson and his staff.We had a great time the hotel was everything and more very clean great location look forward to our next stay there.Highly recommend!
reviews.title: Decent, clean hotel

reviews.text: I have to give the staff credit for being very caring and helpful. The free breakfast was pretty ordinary--both days we were there, the waffle maker was out of order. More important is the quality of the hotel building. The plumbing fixtures in the bath were not properly anchored to the building frame--they were loosey-goosey and we wondered if they would come loose and spray the whole bath with water--they didn't, but the unsecure feeling was there. The building isn't more than two years old--there's no reason that things should be so shoddy. Marriott should send their quality team out for a tour. Being number one in Elizabeth City isn't much of a recommendation.
reviews.title: Best in Elizabeth City don't mean much

reviews.text: Stayed at the Fairfield Inn for one night when recently passing through the area. The hotel seems newer and quite nice. I was impressed with the room decor, the furnishings looked new and were very nice, I loved the bright whites and greens. The room was very clean and lovely.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, Comfortable rooms
Nice, Clean, Comfortable
reviews.text: A few drawbacks were the overall sleep quality. The AC was noisy and blew cold air directly onto the beds where we were reclining watching tv. Yet the room was hot and stuffy without it. Not a major complaint, just something we dealt with. However! The train came through around 4am and blew its whistle multiple times... Then we realized we were on the side by the tracks. Directly above the railroad tracks.

We obtained a "map" from the front desk, who were very helpful with directions. However, the hotel seems to be on the outskirts of the city, which may be a good thing... But the map I was given didn't really provide any detail to help find my way around. That was a bit difficult.
reviews.title: Perfect! Great Service :)

reviews.text: The breakfast wasn't great, but it was good and it provided enough to get the day started. The hotel is also close to Ruby Tuesdays, where we had dinner the night before.
reviews.title: The only and obvious choice for staying in Elizabeth City, NC.

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night, it's located just minutes before you enter town of Elizabeth City. Must be fairly new hotel, am guessing just few years old. Our 2 queens were very comfortable, slept great. Bathroom & room as well as all parts of hotel I saw were very neat & clean. Passed on the continental breakfast as there was an IHop right next door. Staff was friendly at check-in & out.
reviews.title: Good bed, Nice & Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the room was large, staff excellent, clean, and in a great position.
reviews.title: excellent staff and value for money

reviews.text: very convenient for the business quarter of town but not in a noisy position
reviews.title: Regular Coffee Maker - YAY!

reviews.text: for getting to the many and varied restaurants
reviews.title: Good Hotel. Nice Service and very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: would definitely stay there again
reviews.title: Nice hotel, very clean

reviews.text: After a mix-up with my reservation, the general manager comped my stay one night, wrote me a note of apology, upgraded my remaining reservation, and left a bag of chocolates in my suite. The hotel is well-appointed, clean, and comfortable. The staff is friendly and competent. I highly recommend this hotel! I will use it on future trips!
reviews.title: Extraordinary customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is located somewhat outside of downtown and the main location of most restaurants and motels/hotels. It is just off US 17 Bypass which made it perfect for us because we were just passing through on our way north. The location is not really a minus because the critical mass of restaurants on US BUS 17, and others downtown are not all that far away. This hotel had a friendly, efficient staff, large rooms with comfortable beds, and a complimentary breakfast that included scrambled eggs and sausage patties in addition to the usual cold cereals, etc. We would stay here again if in the area.
reviews.title: Clean, large rooms

reviews.text: The Fairfield Inn in Elizabeth City, NC, is always welcoming, clean, and friendly. The facility looks like it opened yesterday and has great landscaping and is extremely clean. The staff welcomes you with a smile and listens to your needs. There is manager's reception, usually on Tuesdays and Wednesdays.
reviews.title: Super place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really like the appearance of this hotel, and their breakfasts and afternoon snacks are vey good. The hotel also is clean. But, the air conditioner is extremely noisy and our sheets didn't fit the bed. Made for difficult sleeping.
reviews.title: Pretty, but not very comfortable

reviews.text: Very clean, very good staff. My stays were more than 6 months apart and they remembered me. Also as soon as I checked in and they saw I was a Marriott member, they upgraded me to a suite at no additional charge. Great pool and exercise area.
reviews.title: Best Place In Elizabeth City...by far

aka: Fairfield Inn & Suites Elizabeth City Hotel
